author: soispoke
content: a bit of a random q but is the PTC selection weighted by stake? If that's the case I guess it would increase the chances of having supernodes in the PTC, which might provide a better signal for the next proposer?

author: fradamt
content: Yes it is weighted by stake, by `get_ptc` https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/master/specs/gloas/beacon-chain.md#new-get_ptc, using `compute_balance_weighted_selection` https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/master/specs/gloas/beacon-chain.md#new-compute_balance_weighted_selection

author: fradamt
content: However it's no different than doing uniformly random selection and then weighting the votes by stake (here you do weighted selection but just count the votes), other than having (much) less variance. There will be numerically more max balance validators in the PTC, but their expected contribution to the vote tally is the same (= the percentage of all stake held by max balance validators)
